item.title: Parking lines very worn and faded, 17th April
item.description:
Along both sides of granville the car parking lines are very faded and hard to see, the whole road needs a resurface as many potholes and the road is stoney due to it crumbling. Swindon street just parrell has been resurfaced and new parking bay lines have been drawn which is needed in granville.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 11 Granville Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 large cones in the road covering what looked like potholes, 16th April
item.description:
We drove past and the cones and holes where enough into the road that we had to cross into the other lane to get past it, but the obstructions were at corners of the road so they appeared suddenly and made us overtake in a blind zone - seems dangerous!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A436, Ullenwood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car park is missing signage, 15th April
item.description:
Car park is missing legally required signage at the entrance for parking changes to be enforceable as per British Car Park Association requirements Car park should also have regular ‘pay at machine’ signs per the Highway Code. Signage was previously displayed as can be seen on Google street view but has been removed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Old Coach House Chandos Street, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes / Sinking Road, 14th April
item.description:
Where the builders who are laying pipes / cables have bodged the refilling of the trenches they are collapsing and causing massive holes. This is currently in the centre of the roadworks / traffic lights. Please get them to fix it ASAP it's dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Irish Butts Stoke Road, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
